title: Funerary epitaph for Gaius Alfius
support: Grey marble plaque (with blue veining), broken on the right, intact on the other three sides. Rear is uneven.

layout.p: Two lines of latin letters, seemingly centred on the stone and beginning from the top, with vacat below.

handNote.lettering: Tall v-cut letters, with serifs, horizontals slightly angled upwards; interpuncts vary in form.

provenanceFound._: Found among the building material in the ruins of the castle.

provenanceObserved._: Alex Antoniou, 2023-07-05, in the storerooms of the museo civico.

graphics.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo J. Prag 2023-07-05.
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo J. Prag 2023-07-05.

museum.name: Museo Civico Baldassare Romano
museum.description: A large and well-displayed collection. It begins with three ante-rooms, in the first of which is a rich display of lithics (mainly Neolithic) from the surrounding area. A display of material from Himera (lion-head spouts from the Temple of Victory and red-figure craters being the principle pieces) and a numismatic gallery then follow before the main room which contains Hellenistic and Roman material from Termini Imerese itself. Small finds, sculpture and inscriptions predominate. The museum collection continues upstairs with non-archaeological material (and a single inscription). The courtyard of the building holds a large collection of architectural pieces and inscriptions

location.address: Via Marco Tullio Cicerone, 90018 - Termini Imerese (PA)
